definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: His fame spread throughout the country.
I don't wish to bring his name down to the dirt.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意让他的名声受到尘沾垢污。

sentences.english: This achievement led to the establishment of what was to become the renowned Connecticut clock-making industry.
sentences.chinese: 这项成就为康乃狄克州打造出名声卓越的钟表工业。

sentences.english: As a magician, his reputation spread all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个魔术师，他的名声传播到了世界各地。

sentences.english: His reputation may even have been enhanced among opponents of Washington's heavy-handed foreign policy.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲甚至在反对华盛顿铁腕政策中的人中名声鹊起。

sentences.english: It hurts them, and then it hurts your reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这会伤害他们，也会损害你的名声。

sentences.english: They decided to have something to eat before going to home, but unfortunately the only spot open was a seedy bar-and-grill with a questionable reputation.
sentences.chinese: 但很不巧只有一家名声不好的下等酒吧烤菜馆开着门。

sentences.english: 99 percent of lawyers give the rest a bad name.
sentences.chinese: 百分之九十九的律师是毁坏律师界名声的大老鼠。

sentences.english: Of course. Every hotel depends upon the repute of its patrons.
sentences.chinese: 当然啦，每家旅馆都要依靠其主顾的名声。

sentences.english: However, a series of food safety incidents has damaged the country's reputation for fine cuisine.
sentences.chinese: 然而，一系列食品安全事件却令中华美食名声受损。

sentences.english: The scandal will not detract from her fame.
sentences.chinese: 这件丑闻将无损于她的名声。

sentences.english: Vera was in no way moved by either his wealth or fame.
sentences.chinese: 他的财富也好，名声也罢，都不会让维拉动心。

sentences.english: A good fame is better than a good face.
sentences.chinese: 有个好名声比有张俊脸强。

sentences.english: A disreputable or run-down bar or nightclub.
sentences.chinese: 一种比较下贱的名声不好的夜总会或舞厅。

sentences.english: Dr Principe wants to rehabilitate alchemy.
sentences.chinese: 普林西比希望为炼金术讨回名声。

sentences.english: He says his accusers are trying to discredit government foreign-aid policies.
sentences.chinese: 他说他的责难者试图使政府的对外援助政策名声扫地。
